info.name: FTP:// and FILE:// - beautifier ("were awfull" 2)
info.description:
Make directory listings from ftp and the local system look nicer. This is just a bug-fix release of user 74's stellar "style 210 [sic]." CHANGED ITEMS If you open these two styles in a graphical diff program like gvimdiff or tkdiff, you'll see that I changed very little. Minor fixes implemented from comments on style 210 For file://, I moved the non-table parts into an ftp-only section and then demanded explicit hierarchy for the table elements, based on the post-rendered hierarchical structure of:

CSS lets us specify an elements by parents, elder siblings, and exact attribute content for each element/parent/sibling. This lets me use every non-snipped bit above, thus mostly eliminating collisions with Sage (whatever that is) and non-auto-generated local html content. You can find more on this at http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-CSS2/selector.html KNOWN BUGS File:// indexes have larger margins, HR bars at the top and bottom, and the default heading format. I cannot fix that without affecting all local HTML documents. user 74's solution was to not render file:// indexes at all.
